aboutInfo:
## About this project

**Harry.io** is real-time, WebGL-based interactive simulation of our solar system. This visualization uses data provided by the [Jet Propulsion Laboratory at NASA](https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/) and [Keplerian equations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kepler%27s_equation) to determine the positions of planets and satellites at any given time. It is inspired by *The Orrery* by C. C. Foster and [100,000 Stars](https://experiments.withgoogle.com/chrome/100000-stars) by the Google Data Arts team.

## Instructions

* Use your mouse, trackpad, or touch screen to orbit around a visual.
* Click on a planet or satellite label to focus on it, and click on the visual name to see information on it.
* To zoom, scroll or pinch the screen, or move the vertical slider located on the left.
* Change the date of the visualization using the calendar on the top right corner, and use the **Speed Scale** to inflate time.
* Use the **Planet Scale** slider to change the size of the planets and their satellites.
* Toggle the sound by clicking the volume bars on the bottom left.

## Disclaimer

This visualization doesn't account for astronomical anomalies (such as aberrations from other celestial objects) so accuracy is only guaranteed within few hundred years from the current.
